=== Topics for discussion ===

These are items that probably need discussion at UDS. They could be converted to specifications:

* Scalable application icons in UNR
* Sounds in UNR
* Logout dialog consistency in UNR (power button, "Quit..." icon, GPM right click, ...)
* Default app and widget selection for 9.10
* Favourites for 9.10 (including sites like Google, Youtube, Ebay, Amazon)
* Desktop loading experience (post-login while panel etc are loading)
* State of DRI2 and hence compositing + UNR-launcher
* Serial consoles out of the box
* Usage of mini-USB port in Ubuntu netbooks (file sharing, networking, battery charging, console...)
* Flash friendly filesystems or alternate filesystems for mobile and embedded devices ("older" jffs2, yaffs2, or "newer" btrfs, ubifs, nilfs)
* Stripping of unused files from installed packages (e.g. man pages, info files, or even changelogs in some cases) to save space
* Android
* Fate of the MID image
* Touchscreen and DeviceKit

=== Administrative Procedure ===

To add more specifications to this page, please use the following procedure

# Verify that you will be attending UDS (either physically or virtually)
# Register a specification on launchpad from <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+addspec]]</nowiki>
# Fill out at least the Summary, Release Note, Rationale, and Use Cases on the SpecTemplate under the https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Specs/ namespace, using the CamelCase form of the blueprint name for the URL
# Add an UbuntuSpec: link to the blueprint on this page
# Subscribe <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~davidm|David Mandala]]</nowiki> to the specification

The deadline for submissions is 21st April (0:00 UTC)
